summary: Completed testing of Delivery Reality View feature. Backend: 23/23 tests passed (100%). Frontend: All UI components working correctly. No critical issues found.

issues: Console warnings about DialogTitle accessibility - not critical but should be addressed for screen reader users

backend: GET /api/delivery-reality/summary - Has delivery_context object with all required fields
GET /api/delivery-reality/summary - Capacity calculation is correct (sprint_capacity = num_developers * points_per_dev_per_sprint)
GET /api/delivery-reality/initiatives - Each initiative has required fields (epic_id, title, total_points, delta, assessment, stories_count)
GET /api/delivery-reality/initiatives - Assessment values are valid enum values
GET /api/delivery-reality/initiative/{epic_id} - Has all required fields including deferral fields
GET /api/delivery-reality/initiative/{epic_id} - Points breakdown sums to total_points
Assessment logic - all values are valid enum values
No capacity scenario - capacity values are 0 when num_developers is 0
No capacity scenario - all initiatives on_track when capacity is 0
frontend: Page title 'Delivery Reality' displayed with description
Delivery Context card shows warning banner when no capacity configured
Configure button navigates to Settings page (Delivery Context tab)
Initiative Delivery Status table displays with correct columns
Table shows all initiatives with correct data (Stories, Total Points, Capacity, Delta, Status)
Status badges display correctly (On Track with green color)
Clicking initiative row opens detail dialog
Dialog shows title with assessment badge
Dialog shows points breakdown (Must Have, Should Have, Nice to Have)
Dialog shows 'Under by X points' or 'Over by X points' badge
View Initiative button navigates to Epic page
Sidebar navigation includes Delivery Reality under DELIVERY section
Direct URL with epicId parameter auto-opens dialog

action_items: OPTIONAL: Add aria-describedby to DialogContent for better accessibility (console warning)
critical_code_review_comments: Backend API structure is well-designed with proper response models
Assessment logic correctly implements on_track/at_risk/overloaded based on delta and sprint_capacity
Frontend correctly displays warning banner when no delivery context is configured
Dialog accessibility warnings should be addressed for screen reader users
seed_data_creation: 1 test epic created during testing (prefixed with TEST_DeliveryReality_)
context_for_next_testing_agent: Delivery Reality View feature is fully working. Backend APIs return correct structure and data. Frontend displays data correctly with warning banner when no capacity configured. Test data exists in database (TEST_ prefixed epics from previous testing). No delivery context is configured for test user, so all initiatives show as 'on_track' with 0 capacity.

mocked_apis.note: NO MOCKED APIs - All APIs use real backend
